clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Nerve Activity in Small Human Intestinal Biopsies in IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Nerve Activity in Small Human Intestinal Biopsies in IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: nerve activity in healthy subjects and IBS patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Starting from the moment biopsies are collected untill nerve activity in samples is lost (approximately 5 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Measuring nerve activity in healthy subjects and IBS patients using both calcium imaging to evaluate the effect of different neuromodulators, immunohistochemistry and rtPCR to determine receptor expression levels and identify neurons and glial cells in the submucous ganglia.

intervention.intervention_name: Rectal biopsies from IBS patients or healthy subjects will be taken during proctoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- IBS patients (based on ROME III Criteria)
- Healthy subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- All subjects with not IBS related complaints
